Name: Add Item Link
Author: Lincoln A. Mullen
Description: Add an add item link to the admin bar

Name: Admin Images
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: This Omeka 2.0+ plugin allows administrators to upload images not attached to items for use in carousels and simple pages

Name: Advanced Search Element Order
Author: Gero Zahn
Description: Reorder elements in Advanced Search dropdown box according to their element types.

Name: Ajax Create
Author: CHNM
Description: Adds way to quickly create records via ajax

Name: Analytics
Author: Tim Hollies
Description: Adds more advanced Google Analytics tracking to Omeka

Name: Analytics Dimensions
Author: Bowling Green State University Libraries
Description: Google Analytics with dimensions for collections and exhibits.

Name: Annotate
Author: Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds user favoriting and note taking to Omeka Items.

Name: Archive Document
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: The format of the documents that is used internally by OAI-PMH Static Repository and some other plugins.

Name: Archive Folder
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Automatically import a local or remote folder into Omeka as collections, items, files, and metadata.

Name: Archive Repertory
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Keeps original names of imported files and put them in a hierarchical structure (collection / item / files) in order to get readable urls for files and to avoid an overloading of the file server.

Name: Ark & Noid
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Create short, unique, meaningless, universal and persistent identifiers (ark and/or noid) and use them as urls for records.

Name: Assignments
Author: Bowling Green State University Libraries
Description: Create a new student role and allow assignment of students to exhibits.

Name: Assign Owner
Author: Anurag
Description: Assign ownership of items to a specific user

Name: Audio Recorder
Author: Ned Henry; UCSC Library Digital Initiative
Description: This Omeka 2.0+ plugin provides an in-browser audio recorder which can attach resulting recordings to Omeka items.

Name: BagIt
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Implements the BagIt specification for storing collections of files. Adds an administrative interface that allows users to (a) generate and export Bags containing files on the site and (b) import Bags and make their contents available through the Dropbox interface.

Name: Beam Me Up to Internet Archive
Author: Pop Up Archive
Description: Posts items to the Internet Archive as they are saved.

Name: Beam Me Up to SoundCloud
Author: Pop Up Archive
Description: Posts items to SoundCloud as they are saved.

Name: Block Party
Author: Jeremy Guillette
Description: Adds new, useful Exhibit blocks, like groups of Items, Collections, or other Exhibits.

Name: Blocks
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds blocks/widgets to public display

Name: BookReader
Author: Julien Sicot (upgraded for Omeka 2.0 by Daniel Berthereau)
Description: Adds the Internet Archive BookReader (http://openlibrary.org/dev/docs/bookreader) into Omeka and allows to create online flip book from image files constituting an item.
Tags: viewer, books, digital library, live book

Name: Bulk Metadata Editor
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library, Daniel Berthereau
Description: Adds search and replace functionality allowing curators to update metadata fields over many records quickly and easily.

Name: Carta
Author: AcuGIS
Description: Add Leaflet maps to your pages, exhibits, and collections

Name: Catalog Search
Author: Lincoln A. Mullen
Description: Searches other catalogs for records related to Omeka items

Name: Category Browse
Author: Kevin Reiss, Daniel Berthereau (upgrade to Omeka 2.0)
Description: Slugify Omeka element values into nice URLs

Name: Central Auth
Author: Bowling Green State University Libraries
Description: Allows login through various centralized authentication systems.

Name: Clean Url
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Displays clean and readable URLs like http://example.com/my_collection/dc:identifier.

Name: Clickable Links
Author: Gero Zahn
Description: Filter non-HTML text fields for URLs and make render them as »target='_blank'« clickable.

Name: COinS
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds COinS metadata to item pages, making them Zotero readable.

Name: Collaborate
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Let multiple users collaborate on a document

Name: Collections
Author: Bowling Green State University Libraries
Description: Set the theme to use for an individual collection.

Name: Collection Tree
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Gives administrators the ability to create a hierarchical tree of their collections.

Name: Commenting
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows commenting on Items, Collections, Exhibits, and more

Name: Commons
Description: Connect your institution's Omeka installation to the Omeka Commons.

Name: Commons API
Description: API for Omeka installations to communicate with Omeka Commons

Name: Conditional Elements
Author: Gero Zahn / Githanjalli Elangovan
Description: Dynamically show/hide elements based on values entered in other elements. Requires SimpleVocab.

Name: Content DM Link
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library, Ned Henry
Description: Adds the ability to import items from Content DM into Omeka.

Name: Contribution
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Allows collecting items from visitors

Name: Contributor Contact
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: Supplies administrators with tools to contact contributors in bulk

Name: Controlled Vocabulary
Author: Jim Safley, Patrick Murray-John
Description: Work with a controlled vocabulary

Name: Correct Citation
Author: Anne Garcia-Fernandez (LAS-CNRS)
Description: Correct the coma position in French citation.

Name: Corrections
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Adds simple user-supplied corrections to metadata.

Name: Course Tools
Author: Jeremy Guillette
Description: Adds user roles useful for courses, including a student role with customizable permissions.

Name: CreativeCommonsChooser
Author: Alexandria Archive Institute, African Commons, and the UC Berkeley School of Information, Information and Service Design Program (upgraded to Omeka 2 by Daniel Berthereau)
Description: Adds a Creative Commons License Chooser to the admin interface and extends Omeka items to be associated with individual CC licenses.

Name: CrowdEd
Author: Garrick S. Bodine and Stephanie A. Schlitz
Description: Adds ability for crowd-sourcing metadata of Omeka items.

Name: CSS Editor
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Add public CSS styles through the admin interface.

Name: CSV Import
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Imports items, tags, and files from CSV files.

Name: CSV Import+
Author: Daniel Berthereau (improvement of CSV Import of Center for History & New Media)
Description: Imports and updates collections, items, files, tags and any metadata or extra data from CSV files.

Name: Curator Monitor
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Allows a curator to monitor the status of records via administrative fields and a page to follow progression of publication.

Name: Date Search
Author: Gero Zahn
Description: Date Search will take of your dates and timespans that you enter in your items' text fields, using the YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format, if necessary with [G] or [J] prefix for Gregorian/Julian dates. In 'Advanced Search', you may search for dates: If you search for '1970', your item containing the timespan '1960-1980' will be found. — Works great with enhanced Item Relations featuring relation comments.

Name: Default Sort
Author: The Digital Ark
Description: Allows an admin to set the default sort for 'Browse Items' and 'Browse Collections'

Name: Derivative Images
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Recreate (or create) derivative images.

Name: Digital Object Linker
Author: Valdeva Crema
Description: This plugin allows you to embed digital images from the external sources to be displayed on the item pages.

Name: Docs Viewer
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Embeds a Google document viewer into item show pages. PDF documents, PowerPoint presentations, TIFF files, and some Microsoft Word documents are supported.

Name: Doc to HTML
Author: Thom Mc
Description: When a Docx file is added to an item, renders it in HTML5 (requires Pandoc 1.13 or later)

Name: Dropbox
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows users to upload files outside of Omeka and batch-add many files at once.

Name: Dspace Restapi Harvester
Author: Ying Jin
Description: Harvest metadata and link the item to their bitstreams in DSpace using REST API.

Name: Dublin Core Extended
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds the full set of Dublin Core properties to the existing Dublin Core element set, including element refinements and supplemental elements. See DCMI Metadata Terms: http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/

Name: EAD
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Creates, imports, exports, manages and display EAD finding aids via OAI-PMH Static Repository.
Optional Plugins: ArchiveFolder, ArchiveDocument, OaiPmhGateway, OaipmhHarvester, OaiPmhRepository, OaiPmhStaticRepository, ArchiveRepertory

Name: EAD Import
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Imports EAD files into database.

Name: Edit Link
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds an edit link to admin bar for items, collections, and exhibit pages

Name: Editorial
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows editorial feedback when building exhibits

Name: ElementManager
Author: Julian Maurice
Description: Delete or rename existing elements

Name: Element Types
Author: Julian Maurice
Description: Allow elements to have a type, thus allowing easier input. For instance, this plugin implements the 'date' type and show a datepicker widget for elements of this type. Other types can be implemented by plugins.

Name: Embed Codes
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows embedding item content as an iframe in other sites

Name: Enhanced Collections
Author: Bowling Green State University
Description: Adding a layer of functionality on top of Omeka's built-in collections

Name: Entities
Author: Garrick S. Bodine (the original work was by RRCHNM)
Description: Original entities models and functions from Omeka 1.x reworked into a plug-in for Omeka 2.0

Name: Escher
Author: AcuGIS, with improvements of Daniel Berthereau
Description: Plugin for installing plugins and themes from https://omeka.org and from the web (https://github.com and https://gitlab.com).

Name: EU Cookie Bar
Author: Steve Ranford
Description: Adds a jquery.cookiebar to the top of the page until it is accepted

Name: Europeana Element Set
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add the specific elements of the Europeana Semantic Elements, which completes the Dublin Core.

Name: Exhibit Builder
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Build rich exhibits using Omeka.

Name: Exhibit Image Annotation
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Annotate images in your exhibits.

Name: Export
Author: Center for History & New Media
Description: Exports an Omeka site as an archive for backup or data transfer.

Name: Export to SPOKEdb JSON
Author: Michael Slone, Eric C. Weig
Description: Exports unrestricted records to SPOKEdb-style JSON.

Name: Extract OCR
Author: Sylvain Machefert, based on preivous work from Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media (upgraded for Omeka 2.0 by Julien Sicot)
Description: Extracts text from PDF files and store them in XML so they can be searched. (Can be used to highlight results with BookReader plugin)

Name: Facet By Metadata
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Create checkboxes for filtering searches by matching metadata values.

Name: Fedora Connector
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Connect Omeka to a Fedora Commons repository.

Name: Feed Importer
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Import items from RSS and ATOM feeds

Name: File Modify
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Modify (convert, compress, watermark, rename or any other command) uploaded file before saving it in archive folder and before creating metadata in Omeka database. Renaming files requires Archive Repertory plugin.

Name: FirePHP
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Output log messages to FirePHP console

Name: Flickr Import
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: Adds the ability to import Flickr photosets and galleries into Omeka as items or collections, while preserving as much metadata as possible

Name: GeoBlacklight Metadata
Author: Stephen Balogh, NYU Libraries
Description: Adds additional metadata elements within a new GeoBlacklight array, then combines these elements along with reappropriated Dublin Core and Dublin Core Extended elements to produce JSON records in accordance with GeoBlacklight schema.
Tags: metadata, geoRSS, geospatial, GeoBlacklight, geometry, map

Name: Geolocation
Note: Really free (no Google Map but Leaflet/OpenStreetMap), smarter, with multipoints and layers.
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds location info and maps to Omeka

Name: Getty Suggest
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: Enable an autosuggest feature for Omeka elements using the Getty Collection controlled vocabularies

Name: GoogleAnalytics
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: A small plugin to include Google Analytics JavaScript code on pages.

Name: Google Tag Manager
Author: The Digital Ark
Description: Adds Google Tagmanager code to your pages

Name: Groups
Description: Zotero-like groups

Name: Guest User
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds a guest user role. Can't access backend, but allows plugins to use an authenticated user

Name: Hide Elements
Author: John Flatness
Description: Hide admin-specified metadata elements.

Name: History Log
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library and Daniel Berthereau
Description: Creates a log of basic curatorial events for each item, collection and file, including ingress, updates, and pushes, and compute statistics on evolution.

Name: Honor Thy Contributors
Author: Lincoln A. Mullen
Description: Give credit to people who have added or edited items in your Omeka database

Name: Hotlink URLs
Author: Michael Slone
Description: Hotlinks URLs in the identifier field

Name: HTML5 Media
Author: John Flatness
Description: Enables HTML5 for media files using MediaElement.js.

Name: HTML Viewer
Author: Thom Mc
Description: Include content of attached HTML file in item page

Name: Identity
Author: Richard Maiti
Description: Identity plugin to make sure that each item in the digital library has an ARK identifier

Name: Idref
Author: Julien Sicot
Description: Adds an autocomplete text box to the Dublin Core's Subject and Creator elements, drawing from the French Subject Headings. This plugin uses IdRef, a Web application dedicated to Sudoc authority data. Sudoc is the French academic union catalogue, maintained by ABES. Also, it requires installation of SimpleVocab plugin
Tags: IdRef, subject headings, autocomplete, Rameau, Sudoc, Abes

Name: IIIF
Author: Klokan Technologies GmbH
Description: IIIF Storage Adapter, items with images from IIIF, zoomable viewer, upload to IIIFHosting, manifest.json

Name: Image Annotation
Author: Center for History & New Media
Description: Allows users to annotate images.

Name: Image Resize
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Gives administrators the ability to resize image derivatives.

Name: Import
Author: BibLibre
Description: Extensible import plugin

Name: Import Hyperlink
Author: Bowling Green State University
Description: Imports details about a Hyperlink including embed code.

Name: Item Duplicate Check
Author: Julian Maurice
Description: Check for duplicates before saving item

Name: Item Order
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Gives administrators the ability to custom order items in collections.

Name: Item References
Author: Gero Zahn / Githanjalli Elangovan
Description: Creates references between items.

Name: Item Relations
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows administrators to define relations between items.

Name: Item Relations
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows administrators to define relations between items.

Name: Item Review
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: Adds the ability to mark all item created by certain user roles for administrative review before publication.

Name: Items Partial Shortcode
Author: Steve Ranford
Description: Creates a new shortcode for showing a custom partial template rathe than the standard single.php used by the item shortcode.

Name: Koha Authority Suggest
Author: Julian Maurice
Description: Suggest terms from a Z39.50 server

Name: KUDL Identity Client
Author: Michael Slone
Description: Uses the KUDL Identity service to generate identifiers.

Name: LC Suggest
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Enable an autosuggest feature for Omeka elements using the Library of Congress Authorities and Vocabularies service: http://id.loc.gov

Name: Ldap
Author: Bowling Green State University
Description: Sign onto Omeka using your local LDAP. Based on the work done by Lehigh University.

Name: Lightbox Gallery
Author: Anna Michelle Martinez-Montavon
Description: Adds new gallery, file with text, and book layouts to Exhibit Builder that display files using Lightbox.

Name: Linked Data Elements
Author: Thom Mc
Description: Overrides core ElementText class to add a URI field

Name: Linkify URL
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add a filter that converts a url into a link.

Name: Live Book
Author: Daniel Berthereau (from bibnum of Julien Sicot (Université de Rennes 2))
Description: Manages scanned books with Omeka: zoom and flip of pages, extraction and displaying of table of contents from PDF, full text search from an XML content (KWIC), etc.

Name: Locale
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Configure language for your Omeka site.

Name: Maintenance
Author: BibLibre
Description: Put Omeka site in maintenance mode

Name: Mall Extensions
Author: Kim Nguyen
Description: Scavenger Hunt layouts for Exhibit Builder and other functionality to be used on the Histories of the National Mall mobile website.

Name: Mall Map
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media

Name: MapFig
Author: MapFig
Description: Add Leaflet maps to your pages, exhibits, and collections

Name: Measurement Search
Author: Gero Zahn
Description: Measurement Search is similar to Range Search: It will pre-process height x width x depth triples followed by a unit stored in item texts to be able to search for ranges. — Works great with enhanced Item Relations featuring relation comments.

Name: Media Buckets
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Creates an Item Type to use a a dumping ground for non-'Item' media.

Name: MediaRSS
Author: Center for History & New Media
Description: Adds a MediaRSS feed to your page templates, which makes your Omeka content readable by any application or service that supports Media RSS.

Name: Metadata Browser
Author: Kevin Reiss, digitalMETRO project (upgraded by Daniel Berthereau)
Description: Set up public theme browsing display for selected Omeka Elements. Selected browsing choices also appear in sitemap file if XmlSitemap plugin is also installed. digitalMETRO Project [http://nycdigital.org/]

Name: METS Export
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: Adds functionality to export Omeka items as METS xml files, either at the item or the collection level

Name: MLA Citations
Author: Bowling Green State University Libraries
Description: Display MLA style citations in Omeka.

Name: MlaTei
Description: Plugin for the CoE MLA Variorum Shakespeare Challenge

Name: More Metadata For Collections
Author: Anne Garcia-Fernandez (LAS-CNRS)
Description: Adds a custom metadata set to collections. Metadata should be customized directly in the file custom_metadata.php.

Name: More User Roles
Author: Erin Bell
Description: Creates dedicated Author and Editor roles. When the plugin is uninstalled, Authors and Editors are downgraded to the Contributor role.

Name: Multimedia Display
Author: Ned Henry
Description: This plugin facilitates customizable display of multimedia content including video, audio, images, books, and oral histories which may be stored on external servers.

Name: Multiple Collections
Author: Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds multiple collection functionality to Omeka

Name: My Omeka
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Creates user logins, item favoriting, and the ability for users to create posters with their favorited items.

Name: Neatline
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Plot your course in space and time.

Name: NeatlineFeatures
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Allows administrators to draw things on maps and associate them with an Omeka item.

Name: Neatline Maps
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Connect Omeka with Geoserver, a powerful open-source geospatial server.

Name: Neatline Time
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Create timelines in Omeka.

Name: Neatline ~ SIMILE Timeline
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Add SIMILE Timeline to Neatline exhibits.

Name: Neatline ~ Text
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Connect text documents to Neatline exibits.

Name: Neatline ~ Waypoints
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Adds a list of waypoints to Neatline exhibits.

Name: Ngram
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Generate ngram graphs from your collections

Name: Nuxeo Link
Author: Ned Henry
Description: Adds the ability to navigate a Nuxeo DAMS and import Nuxeo documents as Omeka items. Designed specifically for use with the UCLDC Nuxeo DAMS.

Name: OAI-PMH Gateway
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Expose files and metadata of a standard OAI-PMH static repository through Omeka used as a gateway.

Name: OAI-PMH Harvester
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Harvests metadata from OAI-PMH data providers.

Name: OAI-PMH Repository
Author: John Flatness
Description: Exposes Omeka items as an OAI-PMH repository.

Name: OAI-PMH Static Repository
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Automatically build a standard OAI-PMH archive from files and metadata of a local or a distant folder.

Name: OCR Element Set
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Creates a file element set for OCR metadata and text.

Name: OHMSxml for the SPOKEdb Database
Author: Eric C. Weig (University of Kentucky Libraries)
Description: Adds a OHMS XML export to Omeka outputs.

Name: Omeka Api Import
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Import data from other Omeka 2.1 or higher sites using the API

Name: Omeka On Ovh
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Permet de créer les fichiers dérivés sur un serveur OVH.

Name: OpenLayersZoom
Note: OpenLayers can be replaced by OpenSeadragon, integrated in Omeka S, and the tiler is integrated in the module IIIF Server.
Author: Daniel Berthereau (upgrade of the release built by Matt Miller)
Description: An OpenLayers based image zoom widget

Name: OpenSeadragon
Note: OpenSeadragon is integrated in Omeka S and the module IIIF Server may create tiles automatically.
Author: Digital Public Library of America
Description: Embeds an OpenSeadragon image viewer to provide zoomable images

Name: Page Caching
Author: Center for History and New Media [upgraded by Daniel Berthereau]
Description: Adds page caching.

Name: PBCore
Author: Pop Up Archive
Description: Creates PBCore element set and related output format.

Name: PDF Embed
Author: John Flatness
Description: Embeds PDF documents into item and file pages.

Name: PDF Output
Author: Klokan Technologies GmbH
Description: The PDF output format for item detail page /items/show?output=pdf

Name: PDF Search
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Extracts text from PDF files so they can be searched.

Name: PDF Text
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Extracts text from PDF files so they can be browsed and searched.

Name: PDF TOC
Author: Sylvain Machefert, based on PDF Search, from Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media. (upgraded for Omeka 2.0 by Julien Sicot based on PDF Text)
Description: Extracts table of contents from PDF files

Name: Peddler Citation
Author: Stephen Balogh
Description: Customizes the item citation field generated by Omeka, specifically for constraints of the Jewish Peddler Project

Name: Posters
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Create interpretive posters using Omeka items.

Name: Range Search
Author: Gero Zahn
Description: Range Search is similar to Date Search: It will pre-process currencies, weights, and other numbers followed by a unit stored in item texts and make them ranges — Works great with enhanced Item Relations featuring relation comments.

Name: Rating
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add a widget to allow users to rate a record instantly.

Name: Ratings
Author: The Digital Ark
Description: Allows registered users to rate items and displays the average ratings

Name: Reassign Files
Author: Gero Zahn / Githanjalli Elangovan
Description: Reassignes files from one item to another.

Name: Reassign Ownership
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Allows owners of collections and items, or 'super' and 'admin' user roles, to change ownership

Name: Record Relations
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Facilitates plugins creating relations across record types

Name: Recursive Suppression
Author: Michael Slone
Description: Allows records to be suppressed recursively

Name: Redact Elements
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Redact admin-specified metadata elements.

Name: Reference
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Adds pages with the alphabetical indexes of specified item types and elements.

Name: refNum Element Set
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Creates a file element set for refNum, a standard for digitalized documents, especially books and manuscripts (see http://bibnum.bnf.fr/refNum).

Name: Reorder Element Texts
Author: Gero Zahn
Description: Re-order element texts after adding additional input for the same field.

Name: Replace DC:Title in all views
Author: Pop Up Archive
Description: Replaces DC:Title field in all public/admin views with the PBCore:Title field.

Name: Reports
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Generates item reports in HTML and QR Codes of items in PDFs.

Name: Rotate Picture
Author: Sylvain Machefert, Bordeaux 3 (@symac)
Description: Allow picture rotation.

Name: Saga
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: GLAMHack Philly Fornaldarsögur norðurlanda

Name: Scripto
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds the ability to transcribe items using the Scripto library.

Name: Search By Metadata
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows administrators to configure metadata fields to link to items with same field value

Name: Search Tweaks
Author: Thom Mc
Description: Customise advanced search

Name: Select2
Author: Julian Maurice
Description: Apply Select2 JS library to existing dropdown lists

Name: Select Owner
Author: Bowling Green State University Libraries
Description: Assign an owner to an item or collection.

Name: Shared Shelf Link
Author: ARTstor, INC
Description: Allows Shared Shelf users to publish image files and data records from a project in Shared Shelf, an online media management software from ARTstor, to Omeka collections. Shared Shelf is a subscription-based service.

Name: Shortcode Carousel
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds a shortcode to insert a carousel item viewer

Name: Simple Contact
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Adds anywhere a simple contact form for users to contact the administrator.

Name: SimpleContactForm
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Adds a simple contact form for users to contact the administrator.

Name: Simple Pages
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows administrators to create simple web pages for their public site.

Name: Simple Vocab
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: A simple way to create controlled vocabularies.

Name: Simple Vocab Plus
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: Allows for cloud based vocabulary definition and autosuggest features for Omeka elements

Name: Sitemap 2
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: This Omeka 2.0+ plugin provides a persistent url for a dynamically generated XML Sitemap, for SEO purposes.

Name: Site Notes
Author: Center for History & New Media
Description: Administrative users can write notes about the site in an an editable space.

Name: Sites
Description: For Omeka Commons -- data about participating institutions

Name: Social Bookmarking
Note: Only common social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Tumblr, email) and embed, but not AddThis.
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Uses AddThis to insert a customizable list of social bookmarking sites on each item page.

Name: SocialMediaElementSet
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Adds an element set for social media. Rarely appropriate, unless you are hardcore about your metadata specs.

Name: Solr Search
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Integrate Apache Solr into Omeka for primary searching.

Name: Spoke Relationships
Author: Michael Slone
Description: Implements relationships needed for SPOKEdb.

Name: Stats
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Logger that counts views of pages and records and makes stats about usage and users of the site.

Name: Structured Names
Author: Michael Slone
Description: Allows the input and display of structured names

Name: SubjectBrowse
Author: William Mayo <mayow@simmons.edu>
Description: Adds alphabetical browse on DC:Subject field to Omeka.

Name: Suggest Anything
Author: UTS eResearch mods to code by Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Enable an autosuggest feature for Omeka elements using the Library of Congress Authorities and Vocabularies service: http://id.loc.gov, SCOT and Geonames via FillMyList

Name: Switch Language
Author: Anne Garcia-Fernandez (LAS-CNRS) and Yifan Zhang (ENSIIE) - Supported by the Labex TransferS
Description: Allow users to choose the website language. Admin can configure the public languages available and the default website language.

Name: Tagging
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Allows free tagging on items to create folksonomy.

Name: Taxonomy
Author: Julian Maurice
Description: Allow to define taxonomies and declare an element type 'taxonomy-term'

Name: TCs Dialogue
Author: Thom Mc
Description: Provides a dialogue where user must accept terms & conditions to continue

Name: TEI Display
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Attach TEI documents to Omeka items.

Name: Terms Of Service
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Allows administrators to specify their website terms of service and privacy policy.

Name: Text Analysis
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Analyze your text using AlchemyAPI

Name: Text Annotation
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows for annotation of text content on a page.

Name: TinyMCE Mod
Author: Jeremy Guillette
Description: Modify tinyMCE settings without hacking core

Name: Tumbleka
Author: Ned Henry
Description: Autoposts items to Tumblr.

Name: UniversalViewer
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Integrates the IIIF specifications and the Universal Viewer in order to create carousels of virtual books from image files and to display any media file (pdf, audio, video, 3D...) in a unified player.

Name: Upgrade to Omeka Semantic
Note: Install the compatibility layer for themes.
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Upgrade automatically your archive from Omeka 2 to Omeka S (metadata, files, parameters, exhibits, common plugins, and themes).

Name: User Profiles
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Adds configurable user profiles to omeka

Name: User Tags
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Allows users to add private tags to items.

Name: VideoStream
Author: Indiana University Library
Description: Embeds a JW Player video segment player into item show pages.

Name: Vimeo Import
Author: UC Santa Cruz University Library
Description: Adds the ability to import Vimeo videos into Omeka as items while preserving as much metadata as possible

Name: VRA Core Element Set
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Create VRA Core element set in Omeka database.

Name: Web Services Shortcodes
Author: Roy Rosenweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Makes shortcodes available for embedding content from web services.

Name: XML Import
Author: Daniel Berthereau (based on GenericXmlImporter of Scholars' Lab)
Description: Imports metadata and files from one or multiple XML via a generic or a custom XSLT sheet and via CSV Import+.

Name: YouTube Import
Author: UC Santa Cruz Library
Description: Adds the ability to import Youtube videos into Omeka as items while preserving as much metadata as possible

Name: Zoom.it
Note: The module IIIF Server may create tiles automatically for the default viewer OpenSeadragon.
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Embeds a Zoom.it image viewer into item show pages.

Name: Zotero Import
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Imports libraries and collections from Zotero user and group accounts.
